docs.text: in the world of mortal kombat , based on the popular arcade game , dark forces from outworld try to infiltrate earth's realm with the ulimate goal of total conquest and the destruction of humanity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the mortal kombat refers to a competition , fought by human mortals against outworld's minions , which if won , will guarantee earth's safety for another generation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mk2 picks up almost immediately after the humans return victoriously from competition .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: despite their victory , however , a gateway has somehow opened , and outworld continues in its quest to conquer earth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: outworld's warriors include an impressive collection of fighters , including shao kahn , mintoro ( a centaur ) , sheeva ( a four-armed ogre ) , and sindel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: earth's mortal warriors , under the leadership of the benevolent god , lord rayden , includes liu kang , princess kitana , sonya blade and jax , who must fight against outworld's forces .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's an easy enough premise , but unfortunately ( very unfortunately ) , the writers try to do too much with the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is only a video game , after all , but the on-screen version tries to go beyond it's comic book boundaries by adding depth , a conceptualization of self-worth , and worst of all , a love story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this becomes very awkward , because all of the players are fighters and nothing more .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they are likable and impressive when they are showcasing their martial arts and fighting skills , but look extremely awkward and uncomfortable when they are required to actually act .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this becomes embarrassingly apparent , for example , as the movie tries to develop a romantic bond between liu kang and princess kitana .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the original mk was smart in letting the players do what they do best .
